page.title: 18Recreation in Stallingboro'
page.content: Most houses have their own garden where families grow some of their vegetables, and a small proportion have greenhouses, growing tomatoes and salads. One form of recreation enjoyed by all ages is the walk through the meadows to the church.The village has its own playing field of about five acres. Small children are catered for with slides and swings and there is an extensive adventure playground, most of the eqipment being made of large wooden poles. There is a football pitch, practice goal posts and a cricket area with a synthetic wicket. Less active recreation is catered for in the village hall where playgroup and various organisations meet regularly. The hall has a wooden block dance floor.
